name: Tyson Foods, Inc.
description: Tyson Foods, Inc. is one of the world's largest food companies and a recognized leader in protein production. Founded in 1931 by John W. Tyson, the company initially focused on poultry but has since diversified its offerings to include beef and pork, making it a key player in the global food market. Headquartered in Springdale, Arkansas, Tyson Foods operates more than 300 food processing plants and has a wide distribution network that reaches customers in over 100 countries. The company is committed to providing high-quality, safe, and nutritious food products, with a focus on sustainability and animal welfare. Tyson's product portfolio includes fresh and frozen meats, prepared foods, and value-added protein products under a variety of brand names such as Tyson, Hillshire Farm, and Jimmy Dean. In recent years, Tyson Foods has also made strides in plant-based protein alternatives, recognizing the growing demand for meatless options. The company's mission is to sustainably feed the world, and it is actively working toward reducing its environmental impact through innovative practices and technologies. Tyson Foods is dedicated to transparency in its supply chain and is continuously seeking ways to improve its processes for the benefit of consumers and the planet.

seo.meta_title: Tyson Foods, Inc. | Leading Food and Protein Company
seo.meta_description: Explore Tyson Foods, Inc., a leader in meat production and food processing. Discover our commitment to quality, sustainability, and a diverse range of protein products.

faq.question: What does Tyson Foods produce?
faq.answer: Tyson Foods produces a variety of protein products, including chicken, beef, pork, and prepared foods.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Tyson Foods?
faq.answer: Donnie Smith is the CEO of Tyson Foods, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Tyson Foods headquartered?
faq.answer: Tyson Foods is headquartered in Springdale, Arkansas, USA.

faq.question: What brands does Tyson Foods own?
faq.answer: Tyson Foods owns several brands, including Tyson, Jimmy Dean, and Hillshire Farm.
